write somebody/something ↔ out.translati: to write something on paper, especially in a neat and clear way, including all the necessary details
The children were asked to choose their favourite poem and write it out in their best handwriting.
to write information on a cheque or a form
She calmly wrote out a check for $500 and handed it to Will.
to remove a character from a regular radio or television programme, by making him or her leave or die in the story
It was revealed last week that Alma is being written out of the series.
